file_content.text: Guess I owe you that drink after all. Never thought I'd see Deth Kregg go down so easily.
Far as I've heard, Kregg's still out there. I'm interested to know how you plan to beat him.
So you're the group that took over the Black Talon for Moff Kilran. Word travels fast in this sector.
I wonder if you might be interested in a bigger challenge. Maybe put a few credits on it.
Mandalorian named Kregg hunts the big game out in the jungles on the way to Kaas City, but he's gotten tired of sport-hunting.
Mandalorian?
So what's the challenge?
Should I be intimidated?
Mandalorians are what you'd call a loose association of clans. Aliens, humans, bounty hunters, mercenaries. But we all got one thing in common.
We fight to be strong. We fight for honor and glory. The bigger, smarter, faster the enemy, the better.
That's why we're working with the Empire: for a crack at the Jedi. That's why Kregg went deeper into the jungle, why he's issued his challenge: defeat him, win.
Sounds wonderful.
I don't know why, but I get the feeling Kregg's about to meet his match.
You mentioned a wager.
I'm not so sure about this.
You're not afraid, are you? Well, maybe you should be. I've seen a lot of guys go into those jungles. Kregg's still out there.
I said there was a wager. Everyone who tries puts a little money in the pot. Anyone defeats Kregg, they win it all.
I'll warn you, though. Once saw Kregg rip the arms off a gundark bare-handed. 'Cause he got bored killing them with blasters. Best know what you're getting into.
For big credits? Sure.
I suppose.
I never turn down a fight.
One more thing. Kregg's not alone out there. He's got more than a few followers. Strength attracts strength.
You beat Kregg, and I'll send the credits your way. It might just cover your med bills. Good luck.
Hunter. I've heard of you. You've been making a ruckus on Hutta.
Welcome to Dromund Kaas, my lord. You need anything shot, stabbed, or otherwise crushed in a blaze of glory, you let me know.
Well if it isn't one of the Empire's own. Pleasure to meet you.
I wonder if you'd be interested in a challenge. Maybe a friendly wager.
You heard of Deth Kregg? Thinks he's the greatest warrior on Dromund Kaas.
